info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:23PM CDT until August 29 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON...SOUTHERN LA SALLE AND SOUTHWESTERN GRUNDY COUNTIES... At 1222 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near North Utica to near Washburn, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Streator, Pontiac, Peru, La Salle, Marseilles, Spring Valley, Oglesby, Seneca, Gridley, North Utica, Flanagan, Wenona, Odell, South Streator, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Cornell, Lostant and Ransom. This includes... Buffalo Rock State Park, Illini State Park, Illinois Valley Community College, Matthiessen State Park, and Starved Rock State Park. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 41 and 56. I-55 between mile markers 189 and 213. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for damaging winds and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
